meanings.definition: A man who keeps or cares for birds.
meanings.sent1: The birdman feeds the colorful parrots every morning.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor is a birdman who has many different types of birds in his aviary.
meanings.sent3: The birdman joked that he was the 'bird whisperer' because all the birds flocked to him.
meanings.sent4: Watching the birdman tend to the injured seagull, I was reminded of how delicate life can be.
meanings.sent5: The birdman's gentle hands and soothing voice calmed even the most anxious birds.

meanings.definition: A man who is skilled at flying or controlling birds.
meanings.sent1: The birdman effortlessly guided the trained falcon through the sky.
meanings.sent2: In the ancient tales, the birdman was said to have the ability to soar with the eagles.
meanings.sent3: During the air show, the birdman amazed the audience with his aerial acrobatics alongside the birds.
meanings.sent4: The birdman's mastery of flight made him seem like a natural part of the avian world.
meanings.sent5: With a whistle and a gesture, the birdman commanded the flock of pigeons to perform a synchronized dance in the sky.

meanings.definition: A man who is associated with birds in some way.
meanings.sent1: The birdman's songs were so melodious that even the sparrows would gather around to listen.
meanings.sent2: In the folklore of the village, the birdman was believed to bring good luck wherever he went.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, John showed up dressed as a birdman with feathers and wings.
meanings.sent4: The birdman's presence in the forest seemed to awaken the dormant songs of the birds around him.
meanings.sent5: As the sun rose, the birdman greeted the morning chorus of chirping birds with a smile.
